Fix: Stale custom context menu entries (#3301658)

Added a new ContextActionRemove protobuf message type triggering the clientside removal of a context menu entry. Since the server only remembers the action identifier and doesn't have a notion of where it is applied to on the client it is only possible to remove all entries for an identifier at the same time at this point. The removal is triggered when overriding a new handler (clientside visibility might have changed), remove a handler and in error conditions.

Fix: Ducking events attenuate Mumble (Win7)  (#3294588)
Opt-out of ducking events. This prevents Mumble from being influenced by stream attenuations triggered by other communications applications. Only applies to Windows 7 with WASAPI since other platforms do not have this feature.

Work around scrolling behavior of QTextBrowser in Log(Fixes #3298338).

QTextBrowser uses a top anchor for its scrolling behavior. As such resizing the Widget from the bottom makes it "scroll" away from the bottom of the log if the widget get smaller. This behavior interacted badly with the new scrolling behavior as auto-scrolling would get disabled if such a resize occurred. As a workaround the log now automatically scrolls to bottom if resized.

Add a workaround for broken CodecVersion messages on 1.2.2 servers

With this patch the client's codec versions should match the versions
on the server.

The 1.2.2 had a bug which caused it to send the same version for alpha
and beta, but we know that the codec switching code will always change
only one codec version, not both and that it doesn't know the correct
bitstream constant for CELT 0.7.x, therefore it will always invert the
state of preferAlpha.

We can use that to decide which codec to change on the client and reset
the other version to the version the client already had in that slot.

Broke up monster Overlay.cpp

Overlay text refactoring and refining

Change overlay text rendering to allow for more flexibility, and take
it out of the single static method it was in before.

  * Text objects are now represented by an OverlayTextLine object that
    keeps more state and allows to create pixmaps that carry basepoint
    information.
  * Rendering can either fit to a bounding box (as is mostly done now),
    but can also use a preset font size, which might be useful for
    elements like the FPS counter.
  * Yet another rework of the layout to make bounding tighter without
    sacrificing beauty.
  * Rendering now defaults to blending instead of overdraw, vastly
    improving quality on some platforms

Indent, changelog, submodule and language update

Refining overlay font rendering

Handle exotic text better: Text that would become extremely small through
baselining is now not baselined, and scaled to use the bounding box. This
goes for extreme accent use, as well as very small "normal" text.

The outline is now at least 1.0 units wide. The bounding box is a bit
loose, but should give proper space for the previously problematic
accented capital letters, as well as some descending accents like the
cedilla.
Added ability to disable logging to DB

Fix a possible race condition on reconnect
Indent, changelog, submodule and language update

More uniform font rendering in overlay

Fixes an issue where overlay text would be always scaled to fit a
given height, leading to uneven sizes depending on content

As long as text is within font metrics, it will not be scaled. Some
extremely high characters (accents on capitals, Zalgo, etc.) will
however be scaled to fit a bounding height, while preserving the
baseline to avoid breaking the regular layout.

Use noise-filtered amplitude for VAD

Amplitude-based VAD uses noise-filtered input instead of raw. This should
be of advantage when the microphone or amplifier is picking up some
constant, loud noise (e.g. AC humming)

Most displays that previously used raw microphone peak levels now show
filtered levels:

  * Audio wizard
  * Input settings dialog peak meter
  * Audio statistics visual peak meter, the graphical noise analysis and
    microphone level text line still show raw input data.
